CreditLine: Bequest of Mrs. Henry Walters [formerly part of the Walters Collection], 1935

Exhibitions.Textblock: Early Christian and Byzantine Art. Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore. 1947.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Nativity in Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Nativity in Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1987-1988.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Treasures in Heaven: Armenian Illuminated Manuscripts
Exhibitions.Textblock: Treasures in Heaven: Armenian Illuminated Manuscripts. The Morgan Library & Museum, New York; The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1994.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The Christmas Story: Picturing the Birth of Christ in Medieval Manuscripts
Exhibitions.Textblock: The Christmas Story: Picturing the Birth of Christ in Medieval Manuscripts. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore. 2009-2010.

Keywords: Colophon; Manuscript; Miniature; Book; Codex; Illumination; Binding; Painting; Treasure binding; Walters Art Museum; Scripture
Medium: ink and pigments on parchment of medium weight, well finished but worn from use
Provenance: Priest T'oros, nephew of the catholicos Constantine I, Hromkla, Armenia, between 1262 and 1266; Hermitage of Ark'-akaghin, Cilicia, Armenia, 1266 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Ter Tiratur, Sebastia, Armenia 1604 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Church of the Holy Virgin, Sebastia, Armenia, between 1626 and 1881 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Church of the Holy Cross, Sebastia, Armenia, beween 1881 and 1915 [mode of acquisition unknown]; Dikran Kelekian, Paris [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, New York, 1929, by purchase; Sadie Jones [Mrs. Henry Walters], New York, 1931, by bequest; Walters Art Museum, 1935, by bequest.
Title: Nativity
